ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Because I hadn't taken Spanish since my first year, which is fall 2019 because of my gap year during COVID, this was a really good class to brush up on my Spanish, as well as learn a lot of important things. Our units included minorities, indigenous culture and misinformation and all were really interesting and relevant.
Became more comfortable exploring the Spanish language through more nuanced methods and avenues. An emphasis on interpersonal communication.
How to better develop intercultural communications through advanced grammar and sophistication. Further study cultures of Spanish-speaking countries in the historic and modern world.
I got substantially better at Spanish speaking and reading, but not listening.
I learned how to read and write in Spanish quite well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought this was a great course, my only complaint is that doing a lot of group projects can be tricky when other group members don't do the work, and some of the readings were a bit dense/confusing.

Strengths: interpersonal communication emphasis, caring professor, and not too high of a workload.

Weaknesses: daily homework felt tedious and like busy work sometimes.

Strengths- enhances level of grammar and conversation
Weaknesses- doesn't allow much practice before applying concepts on large projects.

Strengths: Interesting discussions, creative projects, topics that were relevant and led to development of Spanish skills while also providing stimulating conversation. Weaknesses: Too many daily homework assignments on Perusall.
The grading was incredibly arbitrary with very little communication and clarity, and exams were not made clear. In-class discussions were good though, and some of the homework was interesting.
A lot of busy work and not a lot of flexibility for a 5 day a week class. When every assignment is due by the next morning some days its hard to get it done.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's a great course to expand your learning and also to improve your Spanish!
I would recommend this course to an individual who needs an L4 credit and is passionate about the Spanish culture.
I might recommend it, but be careful with your professor. If you do have Len, then just be prepared for unclear assignments and weird grading constantly.
